page.title: 15The Virginia Estate
page.content: The{Virginia Estate}was created in 1981. The Estate has about 130 houses. The features are a swimming pool, shop, clubhouse, and a phone booth. The Estate was an RAF camp. The aerodrome was built in 1943. It was a bomber station for a Polish squadron using Lancasters. At first, when the aerodrome was being built, imitation wooden planes were used to make the enemy think that it was an operational aerodrome. After the war the aerodrome was used as a supplies depot for RAF Scampton and the houses were built. For a time the Estate was used by the Army (in 1972) then again by the RAF until 1979. The hangers still remain around the Estate. The houses were sold to a private developer, modernised and then sold to individual families in 1981.
